workflow.name: AI-generated LinkedIn posts with human approval using GPT-4, GoToHuman & Blotato
workflow.description:
This workflow is designed for creators, marketers, and agencies who want to automate content publishing while keeping quality control through human review. It integrates four powerful tools ‚Äî **Google Sheets**, **OpenAI**, **GoToHuman**, and **Blotato** ‚Äî to deliver a seamless AI-assisted, human-approved, auto-publishing system for LinkedIn.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does

1. **üìÖ Pulls Today‚Äôs Topic from Google Sheets**  
   - You store ideas in a spreadsheet with a date column.  
   - The workflow runs daily (or manually) and selects the row matching today‚Äôs date.

2. **üß† Generates a Caption with OpenAI**  
   - The selected idea is passed to GPT-4 via an AI Agent node.  
   - OpenAI returns a short, emoji-rich LinkedIn caption (1‚Äì2 sentences).  
   - The result is saved back to the sheet.

3. **üë§ Sends the Caption for Human Review via GoToHuman**  
   - A human reviewer sees the AI-generated caption.  
   - They approve or reject it using a GoToHuman review template.  
   - Only approved captions move forward.

4. **üöÄ Publishes the Approved Caption to LinkedIn via Blotato**  
   - The caption is posted to a LinkedIn account via Blotato's API.  
   - No additional input is required ‚Äî it's fully automated after approval.

---

## üîß Setup Requirements

### ‚úÖ Google Sheets
- Create or copy the provided sample sheet.
- Connect your Google Sheets account in n8n using OAuth2.

### ‚úÖ OpenAI
- Create an API key at [platform.openai.com](https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys).
- Add it to n8n as an OpenAI credential.

### ‚úÖ GoToHuman
- Create an account and a Review Template at [gotohuman.com](https://gotohuman.com).
- Add your API credential in n8n and use your `reviewTemplateId` in the node.

### ‚úÖ Blotato
- Create an account at [blotato.com](https://blotato.com).
- Get your API key and Account ID.
- Insert them into the HTTP Request node that publishes the LinkedIn post.

---

## üß™ Testing the Workflow

- Use the **Manual Trigger** node for step-by-step debugging.  
- Review nodes like `AI Agent`, `Ask Human for Approval`, and `Post to LinkedIn` to verify output.  
- Once confirmed, activate the schedule for fully hands-free publishing.

---

## üëã Built By

**Robert Breen**  
Founder of Ynteractive ‚Äî Automation, AI, and Data Strategy

üåê Website: [https://ynteractive.com](https://ynteractive.com)  
üìß Email: [robert@ynteractive.com](mailto:robert@ynteractive.com)  
üîó LinkedIn: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-breen-29429625/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-breen-29429625/)  
üì∫ YouTube: [YnteractiveTraining](https://www.youtube.com/@ynteractivetraining)

---

## üè∑ Tags

`linkedin` `openai` `gotohuman` `social automation` `ai content` `approval workflow` `google sheets` `blotato` `marketing automation`

parameters.content:
## ‚úÖ Step 2 ‚Äî Generate Caption with OpenAI

### 1. Add Your OpenAI Credential
- Go to **Credentials > OpenAI API**.
- Paste your API key and save.
- Make sure your model is set to `gpt-4.1` or similar.

### 2. Workflow Logic
- The `idea` is sent to an **AI Agent node**.
- The prompt instructs the AI to generate a short, emoji-rich LinkedIn caption.
- A **Parser node** structures the JSON output to extract just the caption.

### 3. Save Caption
- The AI-generated caption is written back to the Google Sheet in the `caption` column.
- The `complete` column is also updated to ‚ÄúYes‚Äù.

---

## ‚úÖ Step 1 ‚Äî Get Today‚Äôs Topic from Google Sheets

### 1. Set Up Google Sheets Credential in n8n
- Go to **Settings > Credentials > Google Sheets OAuth2**.
- Authorize access to your Google account.
- Make sure you‚Äôve copied this Google Sheet:  
  üëâ [Copy this sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oC3dbRkGF_bSIKuFKtSJsYS-ZypT2uk7jPsAni8y154/copy)

### 2. Workflow Logic
- A **Schedule Trigger** (or Manual Trigger for testing) runs daily.
- A **Code Node** generates today‚Äôs date in ISO format.
- The **Merge Node** filters to only return the row in the sheet that matches today‚Äôs date.
- Result: You have today‚Äôs `idea` ready to process.

---

### 1. Set Up GoToHuman
- Go to [GoToHuman](https://gotohuman.com) and create an account.
- Create a **Review Template** for content approvals.
- In n8n, add your **GoToHuman credential** under **Credentials**.
- Use the **reviewTemplateId** from your template in the workflow node.

### 2. Workflow Logic
- The caption is sent to the **Ask Human for approval** node (GoToHuman).
- The approver sees the caption and can choose to **Approve** or **Reject**.
- A **Filter node** ensures the workflow only continues if the caption is approved.

---

I specialize in n8n and process automation‚Äîdesigning custom workflows that integrate tools like Google Calendar, Airtable, GPT, and internal systems. Whether you need to automate scheduling, sync data, or streamline operations, I build solutions that save time and drive results.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
